description: From Latin opiparus, from (plural of) ops + parāre.

adjectives.description: opiparous (comparative more opiparous, superlative most opiparous)

examples: a fair-built and sumptuous edifice, as that of the Persian kings so much renowned by Diodorus and Curtius, in which all was almost beaten gold […], with sweet odours and perfumes, generous wines, opiparous fare, etc.
